intro: Stachys boveana, commonly known as the Bovean hedge-nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Stachys boveana is often found in rocky or dry soils and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
